Boeing plane departs from closed Kyiv airport on technical flightUkraine's Boryspil International Airport, which is closed due to war, saw the departure of a Boeing 777-300 operated by local airline Skyline Express on a technical flight on Tuesday, it said on its Facebook page. Tue, 19 Dec 2023 15:44:06 GMT UDPWAG557VIIRLA7PD3SICGLHU https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/boeing-plane-departs-close-kyiv-airport-technical-flight-2023-12-19/Reuters世界欧洲
Mexico to challenge Texas' new 'inhumane' migration law, president saysMexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Tuesday said Mexico was preparing to challenge a new Texas law allowing state law enforcement to arrest suspected migrants, which he called "inhumane." Tue, 19 Dec 2023 15:26:17 GMT NB6KI3AG7NI5JCJKT6G5HVIHFE https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexico-challenge-texas-new-in humane-migration-law-president-says-2023-12-19/Reuters世界美洲
Azerbaijan says border issues shouldn't get in way of peace deal with ArmeniaAzerbaijan sees no major obstacles to securing a lasting peace treaty with its neighbour Armenia and believes the question of defining their borders can be resolved separately, a senior Azerbaijani official said on Tuesday. Gaza war is world's 'moral failure', Red Cross chief saysThe head of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) on Tuesday deplored the conflict in Gaza as a "moral failure" of the international community and urged Israel and Hamas to reach a new deal to halt the fighting. Pope: Israelis, Palestinians face Christmas 'of pain and mourning'Israelis and Palestinians face "pain and mourning" over the Christmas period as the war in the Gaza Strip rages on, Pope Francis said on Tuesday, calling for prayers and "tangible aid" for the devastated enclave. Germany's AfD hits record high in poll after budget chaosSupport for Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) hit an all-time high of 23% in a poll on Tuesday as the party continued to benefit from the fallout of a budget crisis. Israel's Herzog floats second Gaza truce for recovering hostagesIsraeli President Isaac Herzog signalled readiness on the part of the country on Tuesday to enter another foreign-mediated Gaza truce in order to recover hostages held by Hamas and enable more aid to reach the besieged Palestinian enclave. Who are Yemen’s Houthis and why are they attacking Red Sea ships?The Iran-aligned Houthis of Yemen are playing an escalating role in the Middle East, attacking shipping in the Red Sea and firing drones and missiles at Israel in a campaign they say aims to support Palestinians in the Gaza war. Iceland volcano lava missing town for now, flight impact unlikelyLava spewing from a volcano in Iceland appeared to be flowing away from the only nearby town and the intensity of the eruption was dropping, offering hope that homes would be safe even though seismic activity could last months, officials said on Tuesday. Shippers mask positions, weigh options amid Red Sea attacksA number of container ships are anchored in the Red Sea and others have turned off tracking systems as traders adjust routes and prices in response to maritime attacks by Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthis on the world's main East-West trade route. Israel keeps pounding Gaza, Houthis vow more Red Sea attacksIsrael kept pounding the shattered Gaza Strip on Tuesday while Yemen's pro-Palestinian Houthi movement vowed to defy a U.S.-led naval mission and keep hitting Israeli targets in the Red Sea. Mon, 18 Dec 2023 23:52:02 GMT 6NF7X2O6IZIPNM64HF7XN7DDNI https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/joint-patrols-guard-ships-response-attacks-by-houthis-backing-palestinians-2023-12-18/Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud世界中东
U.S. launches Red Sea force as ships reroute to avoid attacksThe United States on Tuesday launched a multinational operation to safeguard commerce in the Red Sea as attacks by Iran-backed Yemeni militants forced major shipping companies to reroute, fuelling concern over sustained disruptions to global trade. Homes collapse as earthquake kills more than 100 in China's rural GansuA magnitude-6.2 earthquake struck one of China's poorest regions just before midnight on Monday, killing at least 127 people, injuring hundreds and bringing down mud houses in remote villages that never stood a chance. Mon, 18 Dec 2023 16:15:04 GMT KRMKMBYCSRM2RFHPPGYYAFHFGQ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/magnitude-61-earthquake-strikes-qinghai-china-emsc-2023-12-18/Liz Lee, Qiaoyi Li, Ryan Woo世界中国
